item.title: Multiple imputation for three-level and cross-classified data
item.description: Multiple imputation (MI) of missing values in hierarchical data can be tricky, especially when the data do not have a simple two-level structure. In such a case, understanding and accounting for the hierarchical structure of the data becomes more challenging, and tools to handle these types of data are relatively rare. In this post, I show and explain how to conduct MI for three-level and cross-classified data in R.
